description: Principles relating to processing of personal data - lawfulness, fairness, transparency, purpose limitation, data minimization.
Lawfulness of processing - Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one legal basis applies.
Conditions for consent - Controller shall be able to demonstrate that the data subject has consented to processing.
Right to erasure (right to be forgotten) - Data subject has the right to obtain erasure of personal data.
Data protection by design and by default - Implement appropriate technical and organisational measures.
Records of processing activities - Maintain a record of processing activities under its responsibility.
Security of processing - Implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure security.
Notification of a personal data breach to the supervisory authority within 72 hours.
Communication of a personal data breach to the data subject when likely to result in high risk.
Data protection impact assessment - Carry out an assessment of the impact of processing operations.
Designation of the data protection officer (DPO) for certain organizations.
General principle for transfers - Transfer of personal data to third countries only under specific conditions.
